radiographic_examinations.findings: shallow irregular retinal pigment epithelium elevation (SIRE) without evidence of exudation
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The area of MNV increased over time, showing measurements of 11.36 mm² at 10 years, 12.02 mm² at 8 years, and 13.70 mm² at 1 year before death

radiographic_examinations.findings: reticular pattern of hypoauto fluorescence, focal hyperauto fluorescence corresponding to drusen, and tiny hypoauto fluorescent dots in the central macula
inactive subretinal fibrosis in the right eye and angiographic evidence of nonexudative type 1 MNV in the left eye
hyperfluorescent spots in the central macula corresponding to MNV and drusen
visualization of drusen and subretinal drusenoid deposits
presence of drusen mostly in peripheral macula and absence of central macular atrophy
